alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 9:30AM EDT until April 10 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Louisburg affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River At Louisburg. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding begins. Banks overflow at Main Street. River Bend Park is flooded and storm drains are inundated along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Tar River Louisbur 20.0 20.3 Sun 9 am EDT 19.3 15.5 10.9 8.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 930 PM EDT.
